title: Blended Learning MOOC for Changing Attitudes Toward Human Trafficking

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of human trafficking concepts and awareness of social issues
context.additional_context: Conducted in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments, primarily targeting learners interested in social problem-solving such as students and job seekers

learning_goals: Learners will systematically explain the social context, causes, and consequences of human trafficking.
Learners can measure changes in attitudes toward human trafficking prevention through blended teaching methods (lectures/videos + individual projects) and write self-reflection reports.
After completing the MOOC, learners can develop practical action plans for human trafficking prevention and evaluate their feasibility.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
